title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes.
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: But others say, and I believe more truly, that the King, seeingthat the fortress of Kennoway was very strong, and that Macduff had escapedfrom him, and was embarked for England, departed back to Dunsinane withoutattempting to take the castle.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes.
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: When Macduff got into his province of Fife, which is on the other side of theTay, he rode on faster than before, towards his own castle of Kennoway, which,asX t°ld you, stands close by the sea-side; and when he reached it, the Kingand his guards were not far behind him.

title: Tales of a Grandfather ... [ser. 1-3.] With notes.
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Macduff, on his part, kept upon his guard,and went to the King's court as seldom as he could, thinking himself never safeunless while in his own castle of Kennoway, which is on the coast of Fife, nearto the mouth of the Frith of Forth.
